intro: Cheiranthus bicornis, commonly known as the two-horned wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with two prominent lobes that give it its common name. Cheiranthus bicornis is often found in coastal areas and is known for its hardy, drought-resistant nature.
